subject: Business
title: Opt-In vs. Opt-Out Design
description: A 60-second lesson on Opt-In vs. Opt-Out Design.

hook.text: Sweden switched pension plans to opt-out. Enrollment jumped from 43% to 86% overnight.

buildup.text: Opt-in means you must actively choose. Opt-out means you're included unless you actively leave.

discovery.text: The difference is tiny on paper â€” one checkbox â€” but massive in behavior.

twist.text: GDPR made marketing emails opt-in across Europe. Newsletter signups cratered immediately.

climax.text: The power of default applies everywhere: insurance, donations, subscriptions, and privacy settings.

punchline.text: One checkbox can reshape an entire population's behavior.

quiz.question: Why does opt-out enrollment dramatically increase participation?
options: Most people accept the default and don't actively change it
People prefer being told what to do
